description:
BIG AND TASTY!

Super Breakfast Burrito
- HUGE and packed with eggs, cheese, meat, chorizo - just overall a hefty breakfast that can easily be shared amongst 2 people.  chorizo slightly burnt but overall good flavor

Torta de Milanesa de Res
- who doesn't like deep fried steak in your sandwich?  super tasty but super heavy when you get a quarter of the way in.  packed with all kinds of goodies with the cheese, peppers, and veggies

Torta Chilanga
- this wad definitely easier to eat and kind of tastier (maybe because I like saltier food) than the Milanesa, and they filled this one up with plenty of avocado!  a win in my book. 

Pork Super Tacos
- hefty amount of tender pork, good toppings, for some reason not as flavorful as I would like such as how La Taqueria does it, but still delicious

service was very nice, the lady at the counter had to bear with me as i tried to run back and forth to squint at the menu because I did not wear my glasses out, she was still sweet and got all the orders correct

came here because El Farolito was closed but ended up discovering this gem!
author: Tina A.

description:
I live around the corner from this place and have been going here for awhile. I've always gotten their bean and cheese burritos with refried beans, and they've been pretty solid and good. 
Recently I noticed they switched over to CANNED BEANS for their refried beans. I was raised on beans and definitely know the difference, and it's super disappointing that they would do this. Maybe they figured nobody would know.
There so much competition in the area, and I will be taking my business elsewhere. Shame On you Taco Loco.
author: SoCal G.

description:
There are so many taqueria's in this area so as other's have noted this place isn't bad it's just that it's in a location where there is a ton of competition. 

Friendly service , I put in an order for a taco recently to check it out and maybe 5 minutes later my order was ready to go.

A solid taco but not a venue I'd return to. 

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 Garajito
3 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
4 La Corneta
5 Chisme
6 El Norteno Taco Truck
7 Taqueria Los Mayas 
8 Garaje
9 Taqueria Vallarta
10 Little Taqueria
11 La Taqueria
12 Taqueria Castillo
13 El Farolito
14 Pancho Villa Taqueria 
15 Taqueria el Buen Sabor
16 Panuchos
17 Taqueria Gudalajara
18 La Palma Mexicatessen
19 El Tonayense
20 Tropisueno
21 La Espiga de Oro
22 Papito Hayes
23 Tacos San Buena
24 Los Compadres Taco Truck
25 Cochinita Mayan Cuisine
26 El Taco Loco
27 Gordo Taqueria
28 Nick's Crispy Tacos

Below is my top 10 for the Bay Area in case you were curious.
1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 El Jaliciense
3 Taqueria Sinaloa
4 Garajito
5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
6 Belly
7 La Corneta
8 Chisme
9 El Norteno Taco Truck
10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description:
Before we left San Francisco, my dad insisted on one last cruise through the Mission District. And of course, we were also hungry. So of course, we found ourselves ordering some desayuno en El Taco Loco before we hit the road.

Good choice, Dad. Funny enough, we both ordered the chile relleno. Again, great choice. We were served generously egg-battered poblanos that were stuffed with Oaxaca cheese. The chiles offered a nice spicy kick, but the heat was far from overpowering. They were also served con frijoles that tasted like they were fried with plenty of amor.

Sure, El Taco Loco may be a tiny hole in the wall on a mostly ungentrified (at least, for now...) street in the Mission. And you know what? They serve fantastic comida mexicana. Give them a try before the Silicon Valley billionaires arrive to flood this street with kombucha and avocado toast.
author: Andrew D.

description: This place just served me raw chicken in my super burrito. I'm so grossed out right now. I would go back and get a refund if I wasn't already on BART heading home. I reported it to Environment Health. You all have been warned.
author: Devan M.

description: Always pass this place on my way to the bart and decided to stop in for breakfast. I ordered the huevos rancheros. The portion size was filling especially with the extra tortillas, vegies, and rice and beans supplementing the smallish main course and everything tasted alright. No complaints but didnt really wow me.
author: Sean G.

description:
I'd give it five stars cause I loved my fish taco

The carnitas taco was so dismal it would be a two star restaurant

Service was aloof

The cooks/chefs were awesome
author: Foodlover B.

description: Good portion on shrimp but the rice is tasteless. The steak is tasteless as well. Pico de Gallo needs work. The cashier didn't even bother to give me any chips until I asked.
author: Ann L.

description: Some choices here are good like the shrimp cocktail. But their steak is flavorless and their chips were stale. Its hard to appreciate a Mexican restaurant who doesn't make their own chips. My husband likes their al pastor but i have to say this isn't one of my top choice taquerias for burritos.
author: Jane C.

description: Didn't have a great experience here when another group sat at my table and the lady at the counter watched silently. I placed the order to sit and and enjoy - I simply walked out without the horchata I left at the table while I visited the facilities as the group that sat there were touching and breathing on it. I'm not sure I would have had the same experience had my Spanish been perfect. As for the food....I'll update my review when I'm not too pissed off to eat it - the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Daniel R.

description:
This is a totally solid Taqueria. If it was anywhere other than at 24th and mission in the heart of the most intense Taqueria competition, it would rate a 4 easily and if it was outside of California  I'm sure a 5. 

I stop here before or after BART rides because it's on the way, and they have solid tacos, good burritos, and the cebollitas is right on target also. Nothing outrageous or must go, but a good taqueria.

My Taqueria Gold Standard for Reviews
- first time Carnitas Burrito for quality control
- second tacos (usually al pastor)
- fish tacos or shrimp burritos
- good veggie burrito (mostly for veggie wife, but me too sometimes)
- hand made tortillas, good chip quality, and a variety of salsa including pickled veg
- Ambiance - hopefully murals, easy to order, not insane lines, good price
author: Rich C.

description:
I don't know how the reviews for this place are so good. Maybe the people who come here are just the white folks gentrifying the city who don't have any experience with Mexican food outside of Chipotle?

I got a lengua burrito that not only was not nearly as good as ones I can get for cheaper much closer to home, but the woman who rang me up also overcharged me for it. Any place that starts fucking me out of my money gets a big no from me, especially when their food isn't great.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Love these guys. Just about the same quality as other taquerias in the area, but rarely any line. Great food.
author: Adam K.

description: I'm starting to give my order to the cashier, who's said, "Hi," and whose got her pad ready, when another customer comes in the door, steps right in front of me, and starts placing his order with the same cashier, with whom he carries on a spirited conversation.  After she takes his full order and gets him something to drink from the refrigerator behind her, I ask her why she doesn't wait on customers in order.  She sort of apologizes and says something about wanting to ring her other customer up first since she's  already written down his order.  Another patron explained that the cashier didn't "see or hear" me because I didn't greet her in Spanish.  I certainly won't give her the opportunity to "see or hear" me in that taqueria again.
author: Max V.

description:
Those tacos al pastor...

...

...just. So good. So perfect. Exactly what I dream and drool about when I'm traveling and there are no authentically good Mexican joints.

I think they're the perfect tacos. But then again, I'm only now getting down with the whole corn tortilla bit. I'll let you know if I find more. Because I will. It's the Mission after all.
author: Adena B.

description:
1 person. vistiing for interview/tour. Sit down. Early dinner.

Got from San Leandro to SF. First thing: Tacos. Beer. What else could you want? Not bad at all! Seating, the servers were very nice, even left a tip or did I? don't remember but the modelo negro was especial!


*Disclaimer, I am not drunk while writing this. this is indeed three stars, low frills mex food. Just come on in and bring your English.
author: David L.

description: Service wasn't too bad but the food was far from special. The meat was overcooked and tough in the burrito. The quesadilla was way too greasy and after a few bites it became obvious that it wasn't worth it.
author: Zachary S.

description: Great food and great prices. Good location in the middle of the mission right near 24th St. Bart. I really like their soups that they offer.
author: Michael H.

description:
Why wait at el Farolito for 30 mins. when this place is just around the corner?   Burritos are great, tacos are good, but what really takes home the prize is their great selection of Mexican soups.

Menudo, birria, caldo de res, caldo de pollo, pozole, it is all quality stuff.
author: Gab C.

description: What did you guys do to the pollo asado to make it so crispy and delicious?  Maybe more fat grams than other taquerias, but VERY flavorful, best I've had in a long time.  And I've had a lot of burritos in my day.
author: Greg W.

description: I stepped in here again to grab another torta, and catch the Mexico/Croatia World cup game.  This time I ordered the chilanga torta that came packed with Carne Asada, ham, queso fresco, and jalapeños.  The place was packed with many Mexico soccer supporters, and the vibe was very positive.  The torta was delicious,  the red salsa was extra spicy, and we had a great time watching Mexico pass on to the round of 16 :) stop by for a torta sometime,  you won't be disappointed!
author: Marlon T.

description:
This place was a great alternative when my boyfriends heart was set on a breakfast burrito and  Guadalajara wasn't ready to open. 

I ordered the Camarones Ranchero (like every normal person on a Monday morning) and he got some super breakfast burrito. They offered us chips and they had my favorite, a salsa bar! 

I was extremely pleased when our food came out. The prices seemed a little steep for a quick mexican joint, but the portions were HUGE. I'm a big eater and I couldn't even kind of finish my plate. 

His burrito was the most densely packed burrito I've seen in my life. Overall great service, good food, very good find.
author: Brittany L.

description: This place sucks. My boyfriend and I threw up after eating the lengua and carnitas burrito. FUCK THIS PLACE!
author: jeremie m.

description: I went in there and first thing the lady stared at me all rude... Then while we were paying for the food she was whispering to the other cashier and looking at me... The food wasnt so bad i had the coctel de camarones and it was good but there was more onions and tomatoes than anything... My boyfriend had some tacos and he said they were too spicy.
author: Martha T.

description:
On a rainy Saturday, I was working the swing shift and I came here during my lunchtime. With the Giant's playoff admiration, I was hopeful that the taqueria would be broadcasting the National League Playoff on the huge TV.

Instead, the taqueria and its employees and patrons are loyal soccer fans. The taqueria don't realize the Giants are in the playoffs with a huge chance of going to the World Series and perhaps, win it all. If the Giants win, it would definitely be good for many struggling businesses throughout the Bay Area.

But no, the taqueria's main love is definitely soccer. Because of soccer being shown, a star is taken off for that. I do like soccer, esp. FIFA World Cup, but the entire city of San Francisco's current focus is watching the Giants play.

The 24th street is still busy despite of the abrupt rain, including El Farolito Taqueria and many adjacent businesses. So I had no choice and ate here. I ordered the Carne Asada Super Burrito. For $6.00, the burrito is not in the same league as El Farolito's. The meat tasted like ground beef used in a Sloppy Joe sandwich. 

Being here like twenty times and majority of the time, I usually have good burritos from here. Maybe I came on an off-day!

The burrito didn't taste that good especially eating and watching soccer with Manchester United played without United States' own Wayne Rooney. 

Since the Giants are going to the World Series, it will remain to be seen, if the taqueria will show any of the World Series.
author: Matt G.

description: I have been going to this place with my family since i was a little girl, and this is definitely authentic mexican food. I love going to the mission district for some bombass food, and this is just perfect. Their meat is marinaded perfectly for their tacos and burritos. They also have a bunch of soups and other yummy things. Its my go to spot whenever im in san francisco
author: Kayla P.

description:
One of the original taqueria ,home of the big burrito.
My favorite  carne asada and pollo asado mix super  burrito
author: Usalbull F.

description: This was the first restaurant my father went to when he came to the United States from Mexico. We have been coming here for years; however, the service has been declining. The last couple of times we've eaten here, all the open tables are still dirty from previous people eating there and the workers don't make an effort to clean it. I have worked in food service for years and would understand if it was busy and they just couldn't find the time. But in this case, it's always empty when we show up so there's no excuse! Also, I took my mother there on Saturday and not only did we have to clean the table ourselves, there was a hair in my mom's caldo de pollo! I put 2 stars because their food is good but I will definitely not be eating there again.
author: Janette M.

description:
My husband has been coming here for at least 30 years since he was a child.  He introduced me to this place since we first started dating, and we still come to El Taco Loco ever since!  

The service for a burrito/taco joint is actually fantastic.  It's been 5 years since I've been eating here and never had I experienced bad service here.  The girls tending the register are always sweet and courteous.  

We always get the carne asada super burrito, and it never fails to deliver consistent delicious taste!  They always hook up on the assorted salsa bar and the chips!

Thank you El Taco Loco for being consistently great.  Now we take our children to eat here.  Thank you also for the memories!
author: Anh S.

description:
Got the super carne asada burrito and horchata. Burrito was pretty good but not too memorable. The horchata was delicious, though. 

Tip: Green sauce is spicy.
author: Tee C.

description:
Why is this place deserving of a review, much less a four star review, compared to all the other popular taquerias in the immediate vicinity? One word: breakfast! Why is it so hard to find a decent breakfast burrito in the Mexican food Mecca of SF?? I wish I knew the answer to that. And no, "breakfast burritos" at joints that open at 10:00 am don't count for those of us who drive into work during normal breakfast hours.

Taco Loco loco hooks it up with yummy breakfast burritos. Their salsa bar is great too. And it is solid not just for breakfast, the lunch and dinner options are good too if you don't want to wait in line at the more popular spot around the corner. Check out the unassuming Taco Loco for great grub at all times of the day, it won't disappoint!
author: Gunter M.

description:
I loooooooove Taco Loco's fish tacos. Delicious cilantro and onions combined with fish fried to perfection. You cannot beat the price.

I have brought many friends here, and we now have a saying, "Do you want to go Loco?" which means do you want some delicious fish tacos!!!
author: Megan V.

description: It was all delicious!  More than enough food!  All portions were huge.   We had a super quesadilla, a torta, super burrito and pozole!
author: Chris M.

description:
For the past year, I've had takeout from here.  Their beef tacos are to die for! 

After a year of my coworker bringing in food from this place...I finally got to go in today, and got a chicken super burrito.  

Prices = reasonable.

Service = fast

Overall... Delicious and I'll have to try and stop in here again!   And it's right near the 24th Street-Mission BART station!!
author: Fannie S.

description:
We came here after seeing reviews for $2.50 breakfast burrito/coffee combo and needed to see it with my own eyes.  

Well lets just say those days are over.  The super breakfast burrito is now a whopping $8 (more expensive then the amazing version at its next door neighbor el faralito.)

While the burrito came out the size of a small child and the chorizo was pretty tasty, everything else fell short...

Runny guac, runny sour cream, there was no substance and the burrito felt like it was going to fall apart at any moment if not for the ninja wrap job with 5 sheets of aluminum foil.

We won't be back, and so our quest for the best mission breakfast burrito continues.

Until next time.
author: Mike S.

description:
Our original dinner plans were for Mr Pollo, but the claustrophobic space with no available tables sent us running for the hills (or rather across the street) to try Taco Loco. I'm way to impatient these days. Whoever can seat my hungry ass pronto gets my business. 

The bf ordered three tacos: carne asada, pastor & the one with the most flavor, carnitas. He noted that the pastor was savory; he is accustomed to a sweeter flavor. Overall, tacos got the nod of approval from the bf. $2.35 each. 

My chilequiles (under $7) was awesome. Chips weren't too drenched. Topped with carne asada that was lean, but not too flavorful (bf concurs.) Pico de gallo was five stars-- salty & spicy. Chips did not taste homemade, but were crispy. Low point was the strawberry agua fresca; tasted more like sugar water.

Why do taquerias that have good food also have watered down drinks?! And vice versa (i.e. El farolito--we only go for their strawberry agua fresca & always skip on the food.) Is there an unspoken taqueria law that says you can't have it all? Still, TL is a solid joint. Like Arnie, we'll be back.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Best Mexican food ever!!! There are tons of Mexican spots in the mission but not all of them are good, this is a good and authentic restaurant!! 
It may not look as appealing as others but their food is sanitized and priced more then fair!! 
Im from the east bay &sometimes Bart it out here just for their food!!
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
Authentic, delicious and cheap.

Stuffed our faces for $15 bucks :D

My fav taqueria dish is the huevos con chorizo with rice & beans. Theirs is very good. I can eat that everyday.

Also ordered their asada and al pastor tacos - solid. Good flavor and tender.

PS: their "large" horchata is gigantic 32oz!

Will definitely come back for more scrambled eggs :)

PPS: The secret is lard!
author: Cheung L.

description:
Since I had just missed the train back to Oakland, I figured I'd stop into El Taco Loco 2 for a quick taco.  I chose a shredded chicken soft with everything, helped myself to some radishes and tomatillo salsa from he well stocked salsa bar, and settled down in a booth to wait.  It's fun to sit there and watch the cooks behind the counter, as well as to watch the soccer and hear the patrons yell GOOOAAAALLLL when their team scores.

My taco came in about 2 minutes and was delicious.  I was really starving and the cook must've sensed it since the taco was heaped with chicken, onions, lettuce, salsa, avocado and hot sauce. Mmmm....it was so tasty and just what I wanted.

I'd love to come back and try one of the soups or seafood cocktails.  Everything looked and smelled divine, and the place was full of happy people chowing down.

Muy gusto!
author: .Hon H.

description:
I was looking for a taco and some horchada as I was walking back to the BART and spotted El Taco Loco and decided to give it a shot.

There wasn't a wait so I went right up to the counter. The staff was very friendly and bared with me as I debated what to get. Ended up with an horchada and some chicken tacos. Then they offered some chips and salsa, something I've never said no to in my life.

First, the salsa delicious and has a good kick. Having just moved from the East Coast it's nice to not have to order special salsa just to feel a little burning.

The horchada was alright. I've had better but it was still good and enjoyable.

The chicken tacos were very good! I just got it with everything on it and it was delicious. For the price especially, you can't go wrong.
author: Ian F.

description:
This place gets one star for having a Cantinflas mural. 

http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/viv6vq1wSmy_tcmDf1ByGA/l

The food is a 3.5 of 5 but slightly pricy for a burrito. I paid about $6 but it was definitely worth it  for a carne asada burrito. 

Their horchata was damn tasty.

Not the cleanest place in the world but definitely not a problem.

I recommend parking in the public lot across the street.
author: Carlos A.

description:
This is my boyfriend's favorite taqueria, and I think it might just be mine too.

Really, I'm having a hard time deciding because I'm pretty picky about authentic Mexican food. I need the real stuff! Just like the stuff mom used to make...

Their burritos are pretty good. They serve sopes and menudo which are often a bit of a challenge to find.

My favorite thing? Their nachos (I posted a picture in the picture section). Nachos just might be my favorite food. They're great for the person that can't decide what they want because they have a little bit of everything.

ANYWAY, I digress...

Their nachos are really good, and when I tell them to make it spicy they do. They put a butt-load of meat on them, and they're pretty big. I can never finish them.

They also keep stocks of tapatio and cholula hot sauce which earns them bonus points.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
This is one of those hole in the wall places that you hope to discover! There is nothing like good authentic Mexican and this is it!!!! Boo Yah! Everything was mmm mmm good. The Shrimp Cocktail was fresh, the tacos were flavorful, the salsa was awesome and the Chorizo Tacos were the BEST!

You might have just a bit of trouble ordering if you don't speak Spanish, but make the effort, it is SO worth it.
author: Corey Tess T.

description:
Looking for some soup to remedy a hangover and being in the Mission district I knew there weren't any Pho joints in the vicinity so I decided to give the pozole rojo at El Taco Loco a shot.

I'm a fan of pozole. A fan of the colorful veggies. A fan of the spicy broth which conceals the tender pieces of pork. However, not a fan of the pozole served here. For $7.50 I was given a hefty bowl of soup, a side of tortilla chips, and a plate of garnishes which included cabbage, onion, radish, avocado, lime, cilantro, fried round tortillas, and some picante sauce. Looked mighty tasty. Tasted mighty bland. I was expecting a fiesta in my mouth but got a siesta instead. I wonder if it was because I came here at 10am? Maybe don't get soup at a taco shop? Perhaps they were having an off day?

Don't think I'll come back to find out.
author: Steve H.

description: The burrito mojado was gigantic, a standard grade burrito but bigger with enchilada sauce on top with a side salad. The carne asada was tender and flavorful. This quiet setting is perfect for a date or any conversation meet.
author: Edward G.

description: This is where the local eats.  I've enjoyed their burritos, especially their salsa condiments.  Yum!  It's in the burrito triangle (El Farolito and Taqueria San Jose).  For some reason, I like this one the best.
author: Helen L.

description:
Everybody knows McDonald's hashbrowns are the best things ever. But with the economy the way it is, even $2.60 is too much to pay for breakfast. But that's OK since right across the street is El Taco Loco where you can get a delicious fresh-made breakfast burrito for $2.50 (I also got mine with chorizo)! And that includes horchata or coffee! 

Of course I went back across the street for a hashbrown, too.

PS - it's a mini burrito which is totally fine by me because who wants to pound a toddler's arm for breakfast?
author: Albie L.

description: This is my all time favorite Burrito place! The carne asada melts in your mouth, it's delicious. I've only had the carne asada super burrito, and it never fails each time I go in. My friends had other food off the menu, such as the linga torta and they said it was great. I would go out of my way just for a burrito from here.
author: Teal M.

description: As a Los Angeles native I know good tacos and this place has really good al pastor tacos... stay away from the carnitas though, they taste like boiled pig with no flavor, wakala!  Sauce is very fresh and super spicy, really tasty.
author: David A.

description:
This is my second favorite taqueria in the Mission.  I'm all about the lengua or carnitas which are both always tender and full of flavor.  The rice they use is moist and fluffy; I wouldn't mind just having the rice on its own for a meal.  The regular burrito is large enough to cover two meals for me, especially since it comes with a paper bag full of tortilla chips.  

I usually take it to go, but from the looks of the place, I wouldn't mind dining in.  It's pretty roomy, brightly lit, has got a jukebox, and is situated in a good spot for people watching.  The employees don't speak much English, but the lady at the register understands enough to get my order straight.  Parking might be tricky depending on the time of day, but whatever, I park at Safeway.
author: Carol Y.

description: Used to get the 3 crispy tacos from this place for $4.55. They discontinued the fish in their hard tacos cus apparently it was too expensive, so I'm gonna give them 4 stars. The tacos were delicious though. Loads of meat, lettuce, cheese, sour cream. Service was very fast and you could take as much salsa as you wanted.
author: Séamus B.

description:
You are loco not trying this place. I find that not only is it affordable, but seriously good food. 

I have visited several times and have tried their; super quesadilla, huaraches and breakfast burrito. All were amazing. All consist of solid ingredients. The location is perfect (close to BART and MUNI) for those who are on the go.

I recently discovered the amazing breakfast special for $2.99, which includes a breakfast burrito (I ordered mine with chorizo), chips and coffee! That is a deal folks!
author: Hilda Z.

description:
I should start with a word I hope you are familiar with. Posole. Thats a word you all should get know. Embrace that word. Love that word. Now go to Taco Loco off of Mission and order some pork posole. Run, don't walk. 

Ok, now that you've ordered some world class posole try the sopes. Your welcome. 

People are tempted to go the fusion route here in the Mission. Sometimes to a fault. (read: carnitas spaghetti, arroz con eggroll or quesadilla popsicles) Not here at El Taco Loco. Just good ol' greasy spoon style mexican food.
author: Jarred D.

description:
A friend of mine wanted to come here. I took one look at the outside and said "you're kidding, right?" Walked in and found a surprisingly clean establishment. Had the grilled chicken burrito on a whole wheat tortilla and coffee for $7.20! Friend had a chicken fajitas plate. Both real flavorful and considering the taqueria prices this is a real find!

One tip about tipping: If you pay by card, the statement will be printed for you to write in the tip amount. But if you want to be sure that the tip gets to the correct shift, write "0"on the tip amount and put your tip in the tip jar next to the register.
author: John G.

description: I'm not an expert on burritos but I have to say theirs were very fulfilling and at a good price.  Their regular sized ones only came out to be around $6 (as I recall) including tax, and it's sized just right for me (which is not too big).  In fact, I think the price even came out to be less than what I was mentally calculating it to be based on what's listed on the menu board.  Nice staff also.
author: H K.

description:
my favorite spot for a chicken burrito with extra sour cream please! 

I eat here whenever I can.  With everything going up, i just hope they don't raise their prices up.....
author: J N.

description:
Great veggie burritos, and the price is affordable. I usually grab one on the way to 24th St. BART, and am seldom disappointed.

Clean facilities, friendly staff.
author: Wes T.

description: Wednesday night my friend called to place an order burritos 15 and the person would not sell the not if he did not understand or did not really want to sell
author: Melissa M.

description:
Aloha,

This location has some interesting wall art. Anyone look at the back wall under the tv? 

The staff is very friendly. 

I ordered a quesadilla with guac, the boyfriend placed a complicated steak burrito order. His burrito was spot on. My quesadil had only avo instead of guac. The misstep was likely due to the boyfriend's ten page instruction letter for his dish. 

I don't much care for monterey jack cheese. This style of quesadilla  is a chubby folded tortilla with loads of monterey jack tucked in. I prefer quesadillas big and flat, a la homemade.  That's my personal taste. 
You may love it!

I wasn't impressed with the food, but the service was great and horchata tasty.
author: Em L.

description:
So Hubby and I are doing a self-guided mural walk through the mission district today and we decided we needed liquid energy...namely in the form of beer. Mexican beer. He prefers Pacifico and I'm strictly a Modelo Especial girl. We're taking pictures of a mural and what do we stumble upon....what looks like the best hole-in-the-wall restaurant in town. We could be wrong, but they had a neon Pacifico sign in the window, so we decided the angels looked down, saw our plight and sent us a sign. A neon sign.

We're not hungry but as we cross the threshold, the wafting of carnitas reaches our nostrils and as we look at each other....we know. We're eating here. We are so eating here.

We order two carnitas tacos, no onions, a Pacifico and a Modelo Especial por favor. Total comes to 13 bucks US. Plus you get tortilla chips and access to their homemade salsa bar. What the hell...this is awesome!

We get our salsa, sit down by the front window for access to premium people-watching on the streets outside and wait for our order to be called. About five minutes later, we gaze upon two tacos mounded, nay HEAPED, with carnitas, a red slightly spicy sauce and cheese. Just the perfect amount of grease to verify their authenticity, followed by cold Mexican beers and we're in heaven. We inhale the offerings before us, thank the angels for smiling down upon us, bid farewell to our fun little find and venture back out into the mission district for more mural hunting. Ah El Taco Loco 2, I will think back and remember you fondly.
author: Stacey H.

description: Great tasting Mexican food. Large portions and friendly service. I definitely recommend this place!
author: Ana C.

description:
Moments of deliciousness over shadowed by sub par al pastor.  First off, when I walked in I was surprised how empty it was. It was nice to not to have to deal with annoying hipsters in tight black jeans and random dirt bags. So I got my usual (super al pastor burrito, carnitas taco and a strawberry aqua fresca) and the total came out to $11. Little pricey for the mission but still a good deal.

The carnitas taco was excellent. The carnitas was nice and tender with a crispy outside. Salsa was on point and tortilla was fresh. The burrito was a little bit of a disappointment after the taco. The al pastor had good flavor but there was too much sauce on the meat. It made the burrito really sloppy. The rest of the ingredients were good but I couldn't get past the sauce amount. 

Ultimately I don't think I would come back here with el farlito so close.
author: Jeff P.

description:
3.5 stars - this was first of 4 taquerias we tried on 24th Street during Sunday Street in the Mission.  

We had the lengua taco and a horchata.  I grabbed a table and got some salsa while hubby waited for the order.  The lengua was very good, not just tender but has a nice beef flavor to it.  The horchata was good too, just the right mix of rice and cinnamon flavors.  

You can't beat the price too...or so you thought until we hit other taquerias, unbelivable!
author: Gloria H.

description:
I live in what I lovingly refer to as "Taqueria Canyon" and have frequented pretty much every place within a six-block radius of 24th and Mission over the last 4 years. Over this time I've had my favorites, mainly Farolito, San Jose, La Taqueria, and now... Taco Loco. I eat at least 4 burritos and/or tacos a week, and am sort of picky about who I give my business to. I judge Taquerias based on a few crucial criteria - and this is how El Taco Loco adds up:

1) Do I ever get sick from the food? - Taco Loco has never made me sick. Farolito has - several times, in fact. We're not just talking upset stomach here, we're talking food poisoning.

2) Is it expensive?
Taco Loco has the cheapest prices around for regular/super/veggie burritos, and the burritos are huge! San Jose and La Taqueria are both too expensive to eat at regularly. Pancho Villa, El Toro and Cancun have small burritos for the money. The main reason why this place is my favorite!

3) Is the meat incredible? 
Best Carnitas in the Mission - hands down! Al Pastor here is awesome - it's a little different every time (sometimes they put cloves in it!) Chicken is good, Carne Asada is not their strong suit, but acceptable. At the end of the day, pork is king here.

4) Do they give you free chips? 
Yes - though they are occasionally stale. My one gripe about the place, but they are still free. Farolito and La Taqueria charge you - total bullshit. Chips are part of the burrito experience.

5) How is the salsa? 
It is very good, but Farolito has my favorite salsa verde and San Jose has the freshest pico de gallo. It's a slight weak point which will sometimes sway me to go to San Jose - but I ALWAYS come back to the 'Loco!

6) Is it crowded with clueless chatty hipster kids and sleazoids? 
Farolito is the most overrated place, and it's refreshing to always go to Taco Loco and not have to deal with annoying people in lines. The staff is friendly and I get my food within 3-4 minutes every time. San Jose is also mind-blowingly uncrowded, even late on a Friday night!

7) Do the burritos have something special about them that keep you coming back? 
There is a mystical quality to Mission burritos that allow you to eat them every day for a week, or more. Some places have it, some don't. El Taco Loco definitely has it, and I still do not get tired of their burritos/tacos after eating there well over 100 times. The food is always made with love and the super, regular, and even veggie burritos are satisfying every time. 

Bottom Line:
The people who own Taco Loco know how to treat their customers, and they are all very nice and friendly without imposing. I look forward to bringing new people to try the food, and support them as I do all local businesses that have something special to offer. I don't think you can go wrong with the 'Loco, and it's one of the best-kept "secret" Taquerias in the Mission. I selfishly hope they don't become too popular, but ultimately wish the best for their business.
author: Chris j.

description:
The burritos taste decent, not the best around this area but its worth the 7 dollars for a super burrito. Surprising they substitute lettuce instead of beans if you choose to in their burritos places, most of the places in the Mission don't serve that, so that was good. 
This place was cleaner than most places around this area. good service, but i've had better.
author: Q W.

description:
The dilemma:

You want something cheap, not too big, but really want avacado and sour cream....whatever do you order?

A most taquerias, this would be a huge problem. But not here, they have sopes for under a dollar! And they're wicked yummy.

This is so much better than the overrated El Farolito around the corner, although it seems like the long lines have started to get people to come here and discover its yumminess.

Great homemade salsa too.
author: Mark A.

description: Delicious burritos. Nice spicy hot salsa. Too bad you have to get buzzed into the bathroom, but that goes with the neighborhood.
author: Patrick S.

description: I have to say.. I changed my mind a bit. Still like Taco Loco but La Taqueria has the best carnitas. Taco Loco is always good for a change of pace though.
author: Aaron V.

description:
Hungry, drove by looking for food, and found this place. Small little place on 24th and Mission, it was really good. 
We ordered the Super Nachos ( avacado, chips, meat, lots of sour cream, for $10!!!!, and you get all YOU CAN EAT SALSA! YES, you heard right. GOOD SALSA!   which fed two big buff strong guys, and a hugry girl. WOW, can you believe?  BTW, we got FREE water! BESTA! EVA!!!  
...and best, we didn't even finish the food. 
GOod job EL TACO LOCO 2!!
author: Monika T.

description:
I mean it wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't anything special. 

We came here to try another taco instead of drunkenly going to the magic of El Farolito. There was talk of another place having something similar to the avocado green sauce, but alas it was nothing but a rumor. 

Three of us shared two veggie tacos. They were OK, but nothing like the wonderful mess that is EF. 

The place is pretty clean, & the people were nice, but nothing to write home about. Just yelp about.

Their chips are really wonderful though.
author: Rebekah K.

description:
Taco Loco is a serious contender for King of the Cage.  I'm talking about a two-men-enter-one-man-leave Taqueria Titan.  My taq. triumvirate also includes Taq. San Francisco and Taq. Guadalajara, all on 24th St.   If you like one of these, you probably will like them all. 

Hits:

1)  Pork products: a rotating spit of al pastor and about 10 lbs. of carnitas under hot lights greet you upon entering.  I'd much rather see that than some name-tagged uber-chipper hostess any night of the week.

2)  Burritos are consistently excellent in every way.  I usually order a super al pastor with black beans and no sour cream.  The tortilla is almost always well grilled and served hot with abundant melted cheese.  The meat is the star of the show, taking up almost two-thirds of the insides.  Beans and rice play a supporting role, like a Black Sabbath bass line.  

Veggie-wise, the fresh and spicy pico de gallo mixes with the gloppy (in a good way) guac to trick your brain into thinking that you're eating something almost healthy.  Almost.  The well-barbecued pastor is not exactly the leanest of meats.

Even on an off night, the worst I've had has been a 4-star burrito -- only a little bigger than average, a few shreds of unmelted cheese, and other minor whinings.  

But on a night like tonight, the stars were aligned for the eclipse, and the forearm-sized super-hot multi-hyphenated giant-killer brought much-needed closure to a long work day.

3)  Carrot products: excellent (albeit a bit pulpy) carrot juice, and even better (and plentiful) spicy carrots.  I'm turning orange, and I fucking love it.  The salsa verde and pico de gallo are good, too.

Misses:

1) Like many taquerias, the chips are only factory-fresh.  Tonight they were a bit stale.  But do you really go to a taq. for the chips?

2) The place occasionally smells like some strong fresh-scented industrial cleaner.  Such is life near the 24th and Mission BART.   At least you know they're keeping it clean -- they consistently wash their hands here, particularly before throwing carrots into their huge juicer.  That's a plus.
author: Steve K.

description:
I'm not sure when it happened, but El Taco Loco #2 became my favorite place to pick up al pastor and carnitas tacos.  For al pastor, I used to go to San Jose and La Altena, and for carnitas, I used to go to Guadalajara and El Metate, but I can't remember the last time I went to those places.  Now there is only El Taco Loco.

In all fairness, I would probably go to El Metate more often, but it's a whopping six blocks from my house, while El Taco Loco is piss drunk stumbling distance away.

I can't really figure out why this place is so empty, while, for example, El Farolito stays busy.  I'm not an El Farolito hater (in fact, I love the carne asada there), but both places seem pretty equal to me in terms of overall quality of food, salsas (I like the salsa verde a little better at El Taco Loco, chunkier, more character), cleanliness, and friendliness.  Yet El Farolito is packed (even during times El Taco Loco is open), while only some people are in El Taco Loco.  Is it really the minor price difference?  If so, I guess you pay a little extra not to stand in line.  Fair trade to me.

One random thought: Ever notice how there is a positive correlation between whether a taqueria serves radishes on the side and the general quality of the place?  Not a surefire test, but a pretty good indicator.

Also, one small bit of false advertising.  Buche does not mean pork neck.  It means pork stomach.  Tasty, tasty pork stomach.
author: David C.

description:
If you're looking for the best Burrito spot in the Mission, don't even bother going anywhere else. I;m a burritophile myself, and have searched the SF landscape high and low for the bet burrito and Horchata. It's this place.
They also have a damn good juke box with Shakira and mariachi rockin' on it at high volume. Very kind and efficient service, perfect size, atmosphere, and food. 

The shrimp burritos, salsa, and chile verde are the perks. Checkitout.
author: Lauren S.

description: Large, yummy burrito for a bit less than 8 bucks.  Would have been 4 stars, except the burrito was wrapped poorly and exploded when I started to eat it.
author: Danny C.

description:
El Taco Loco is the best taqueria in the sea of taquerias in the city. Even if sanitation has cracked down on some of my favorite meats due to the gentrification of the Mission. El Taco Loco is a family owned and operated business. The restaurant is constantly being cleaned and restocked with goods.

My favorite dishes are the Al Pastor tacos and burritos and the Caldo de Rez (Beef Soup). There is something magical about the food preparation; perhaps it's the way the meat is minced and grilled on the spot rather than sitting around in some kind of sauce like all those fake Mexican restaurants do. The way I eat the tacos and burritos is without rice and lettuce and like all the best taquerias in the world is all about the sauces; whether green or red. They got them and they are free in an open bar cart.

The only reason for my four stars is due to the lack parking and the proximity to a Mission bus station, but then again it is the city. Well if you must know some people, not me, park in the Safeway lot next door. So there you go!
author: Humano T.

description:
$6.60 for super/wet burritos. Btw, mojado is the same as wet... avoid these abominations at all costs - they are loaded with gooey, melted cheese, oversaturated sauce, and overall make for a messier-than-normal eating experience. 

I got the 4.90 regular burito instead. Did you know they don't charge tax, so booyeah! Yeah, you heard me! Their beverages linger around the range of 1.50 for a medium. 

Extra pros to this beautiful placement are its spaciousness, cleanliness, brightness, and immediate proximity to the 24th St BART station.
author: Carl Z.

description:
My rating is an average of the three times I have eaten here.  While house-sitting in the mission this week, I had a ridiculously huge amount of options for my post-work burrito fix.  I stopped into El Taco Loco 2 on a whim and got a veggie burrito.  It was delicious and big enough to save half for lunch the next day, what a deal!

The next day I went back for veggie burrito #2, it was good but not as good as the one from the day before.

Two days later, starved and heading home down 24th st again, I stop in one last time for my third veggie burrito.  It was downright yucky.  The salsa/lettuce to bean/rice ratio was way off and it was so soggy I had to put it in the toaster oven to crisp it up enough to be palatable.

Overall, I have only experienced the veggie burrito.  My friend who ate there with with me had a shrimp burrito and loved it, however.

Go at your own risk, maybe the meatstuff is better?
author: Jessica P.

description:
I used to live right above this place (as in, the window directly above the facade was my bedroom).  I'll admit that I was often under one influence or another when partaking in El Taco Loco's delicious chorizo burritos, but that should only dampen my 5 star review by about half a star.  Since there is no option for "half a star", I have to give this deliciously meat-heavy burrito a 5* rating.  Similarly, the super chorizo breakfast burritos are packed full of spicy meat and guacamole and sour cream.  It makes me feel like a champion.

Bonus points for taking credit card!
author: Kyle W.

description:
Quality, quality food, great service, and a generous kitchen. A pound(usually more) of Carnitas or Buche all chopped up and ready to go with hot tortillas & all the fixins you want goes for a measly 10 clams, OTD, here. I dare you to find a better deal! On your way to your homeboy/girl's pad, stop by Foods Co for a 30 pack of Tecate and you and 9 of your friends got yourself a sweet pachanga for under 30 bucks. I wouldn't steer ya wrong!
-
Lush Life
author: NaN K.

description:
The best tacos, and tostados you can get! Cheaper than most chains even but much better quality.

Everytime I go home to my "hood" it's Mitchell's Ice Cream & Taco Loco.
author: Valerie F.

description: This place is off the hook! My family lives in San Fran in the Mission District so I came here often. Currently, I live in Sacramento and can't find a place who makes food they way this place does. My dad brought me a burrito from here on one of his visits; it's as good as I remembered it. I've been eating at El Taco Loco since I was a child and from then to now, it still tastes good! Honestly, its like love in my mouth. They're pretty quick and always busy. I've never had any problems throughout the years and when I visit San Fran, this is the must stop at place. Seriously, the burritos are so good it makes you want to slap someone in the face. Gotta try it!!
author: Jessica C.

description:
My friend and I were seeing Sugar and Gold at 12 Galaxies.
We got hungry while walking to BART from the show, and decided to get a veggie burrito at this place.

Okay, the burrito was great.  Only problem is we forgot to ask for no cheese and no sour cream as I am (sadly) lactose intolerant.   Anyways, I ate the majority of my half anyways, avoiding what dairy products I could.  I also had a BUNCH of peppers.

We decided to go back to 12 galaxies afterwards, and all of the sudden, while walking down mission street, I get sick.
Not just once but about five times.

2 stars because I don't know if it was the place's fault or mine. :[
author: Jennifer H.

description: I love pork in almost all forms, but there's something special about fried pork and this unassuming taqueria has the best carnitas I've ever had. It's actually fried, perfectly tender, flavorful without being too salty and not greasy. It's so heavenly that I bet it'd be good in just about anything you can get there.  This spot is definitely no frills, but clean and has lots of seating. I'm a huge El Farolito fan but I'm glad I've found a solid, nearby alternative with better carnitas. Taco Loco's going into the rotation for sure.
author: Kristina A.

description: Always ok but please keep an eye on meat and produce freshness. Meat is a lot fresher sometimes than others and I wish all Mexican restaurants understood the importance of making fresh salsa daily.
author: Truth B.

description:
We were just hanging out around 24th and Mission when I saw this place. I admit to being a bit hesitant and first since it didn't seem all that crowded so I looked it up on the Yelp iPhone app. As you probably can see, people seemed to have loved it so we gave it a try. 

Best tacos ever. 

I'll definitely be returning when in the area and need to satisfy a taco craving. Noticed some not-so-common meats on the menu which might be worth a try. Overall, a great experience.
author: Jon N.

description: I had to work in the area one time and asked the Latino staff what's a good place for tacos around 24th and Mission. He gave me several recommendations: if you want good salsa, go to this; if you want good sauce, go there. etc. He recommended El Taco Loco for best marinated meat. Boy I'm not disappointed. The fish taco is my favorite. Hot sauce is for real, not the wimpy watered down ones. This is my favorite taco place in town.
author: Carol C.

description:
We stopped here after running some errands because we were famished. The food was great. I had a super burritos, which was honestly one of the best I've ever had. My wife had the chicken super tacos, which were also delicious. The service was excellent and fast. They kindly let me mix Asada and Chorizo and delivered the food to our table. Also seem to have quite a few specials every day. 

It's a bit pricey for the area and the salsa bar could use an upgrade (the salsa too). But the food itself was fantastic. Good portions with enough for both of us left over for dinner the next night.
author: John B.

description: A-MAZING tacos... cool people can't wait to go back to try everything else they have to offer...
author: Michael A.

description: I love El Taco Loco.  I am not an expert at tacos but love trying them wherever I can.  There are a million great places to get tacos, especially in the mission.  I stumbled in here about five years ago and have always had great tacos.  Recently I was with a friend who insisted we try La Taqueria (neither of us had been but had heard all the great reviews).  In my opinion El Taco Loco is much better.  I usually have chicken or carne asada.  They have most everything else you would want as well, and seem to have various seafood dishes on weekends (signs are in spanish so I am not really sure).
author: Steve W.

description: great carne asada  quesadillas  also meudo one of the best in town huge portions  down side is having the mission thugs graffiti in the restroom /shut be customers only shame on them ,, and please don go there for 99 cent breakfast macdonalds is right across the  street
author: Salvador G.

description:
taco locoooo makes me loco!!

its so delicious. 2.50 for a taco and you can load it up w salsa and make it a HUGEE TACO. 

yum yum
author: Lily T.

description: I had their chicken quesadilla.. just the regular but it seemed like it was a super quesadilla.. it was huge!  I've had tacos and burritos here due to the familia and it was never a let-down.
author: Tram N.

description:
I love taqueria murals. I especially love when the food is personified in the murals. Baby papusas holding hands, tortas with mustaches and six shooters, etc. Ah, I love it all. One of the best things about El Taco Loco is the mural outside the building. Wait, first of all, it's not right out front, it's on the side of the building that faces the 24th St. BART, above where the roof of Carlos' Club ends. Look up next time you're in the area. So this mural, it's a jalapeno with a gun chasing after a frightened taco. The jalapano looks like a bad ass and the taco looks like a nerd, meaning he has glasses. I wonder why they call it El Taco Loco when the jalapeno is obviously the crazy one. I want to know that story.
So, El Taco Loco, the food is pretty good. The al pastor is nice and satisfying. There is a salsa bar with some hot salsas. The place is clean. The price is good. It's way better than El Farolito's and there's no line out the door. They pack the tacos with meat. Oh, and it's right next to BART, not to mention Carlos' Club. Carlos' Club always reminds me of that part in Gremlins where they take over the bar Phoebe Cates works at. I'm not sure why, maybe because that bar seems so festive and the movie takes place at Christmas time. Either way, El Taco Loco gets my vote.
author: Daniella C.

description: They bbq pork burritos are very best tasty and so giant like fat american baby arm. meat and other ingredients ratio heavy on meat side and still cheap cost. i had yummy nachos too before and very large portion so ridicurous i cannot finish them all. usuarly  i eat everything on plate but that time i must save for later time and nachos not so crispy and scrumptious when saved until later time drunk night.
author: Tihani K.

description: Oooh so good.....living in the mission provides me with so many options when it comes to mexican cuisine, but here's a place that stands out among all the rest. There ceviche is quite amazing and CHEAP!  Every time I walk by Papalote and there is some ridiculous line outside I wonder are these people really too lazy to walk a block away and do they like to pay for extra salsa?  El taco is the right price and the right taste.
author: Heather H.

description:
Since there are so many Mexican restaurants within even a one block radius of this place, it's only worth considering El Taco Loco (ETL) relative to its alternatives. I'll compare it to El Farolito, the nearest of these alternatives (I've never been to Taqueria San Jose).

Price: El Farolito wins.  Burritos looked a bit pricey at ETL, but (to be fair) they were enormous. 

Friendliness: ETL wins, maybe just because El Farolito is a madhouse with customers most of the time.

Salsas: I prefer ETL's, especially since they have a little more variety.

Ingredients:  El Farolito by a long shot. Good marinades at ETL, but the tortillas and cheese at El Farolito are the best I've had in SF.  

Summary: El Farolito is a better deal and tastes a little better, but if the line is out of control (as it is much of the time), ETL is a nice alternative.
author: Daniel S.

description: I was very dissapointed with the food. Ate there once, won't ever again, especially when there are so many taquerias to choose from. I tasted a torta and a quesadilla, the meat was gross and both were simply not good. The place had a feel like it could be a chain. Don't expect much, but than again, some people like that place...go figure.
author: M S.

description: i find it better than el farolito around the corner, great service and very quick as well, its always good to judge a mexican place by their tacos because burritos dont really exist in mexico , this place did a good job , menu is nice and clean and have everything you could ask for , will be there again soon :)
author: NAEL K.

description: One of the Top 5 San Francisco taquria's, and there is never a long line unlike Farlito around the corner. Carnitas Mmm so good, Carne Asada is juicy! and they toast their burritos to perfection. Big, spicy and have a great finish! Next time your in line at Farlito, head around the corner. By the way the grilled pollo is all white meat and the boiled is dark.
author: Jeff C.

description: This place rocks!!  Cheap food without the side effects of upset stomach.  Twenty dollars actually WILL feed your hungry being at this place.  Hell, $20 might be all you need for You and Your date.  The food is tasty, and cheap.  What else is there to life?
author: brenda b.

description: This used to be one of my favorite spots in the Mission.  But their al pastor recipe seems to have changed.  I recently had a very uneven burrito that had as much orange grease as other fillings - and I usually like the orange soup.  When I first ordered, the girl gave me a basket with 15 or so STALE and obviously-not-homemade chips.  And prices seem to have gone up.  What happened?
author: Nathan W.

description:
ok, the other great place for an al pastor super burrito in the city. but really, what makes this place tits is that they give you SO MUCH FOOD!  and for decent prices too!  i mean, their burritos are f-in' huge!  and damn good too!  i can vouche for their nachos too, and i know we've had other stuff, but yeah, definite quality taqueria goodness!

UPDATE 2012 - this place has really gone downhill, food quality wise.  and i'm pretty sure i got the runs from eating here once as well, as have several of my associates.
author: eric i.

description: Look foward to eat there next Weekend with their Fabulous Salsas!
author: Robert G.

description: Cheap Mission burritos. Good stuff. Salsa that hasn't been sitting for a few days. Clean. Enough said.
author: Alexander G.

description: They have some great burritos here. I'm a fan, but this is def my hubby's fave taqueria!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Yummy tacos!  You definitely get your money's worth! I got the beef tacos and the quality and freshness is just excellent! You tell yourself two is enough but try to squeeze in a third! Cheap eat! So worth it!
author: Mel P.

description: Lovely lengua burrito, no super option necessary. Ditch the chips.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I'm always looking for my new favorite burrito joint and this place is a real contender. I was a bit reticent at first, given it was empty and fairly dumpy, even by Mission standards. But don't let that stop you from enjoying a great burrito! Al Pastor is my go-to and these guys don't disappoint in that department. The meat is tender, the proportions of ingredients spot-on and the burrito well-wrapped. Minus points for stale chips and a lackluster salsa bar (though the salsa verde was tasty), but it's forgivable since they deliver a pretty satisfying burrito experience.
author: Chris O.

description:
This place is good, quick, and cheap.

Unfortunately this place is not open late but it is easily the best taco shop on the four corners... apparently nobody else knows this cause this place is usually quite empty.
author: Henry C.

description: I was on 24th Street today and decided to stop in at Taco Loco. I ordered the Super Taco with BBQ pork. It was really great....soft, steamed tortilla, tasty pork, cheese, guacamole.....yum. They also have a stand with various sauces, radishes, chilis and salsa fresca. Great prices and tasty food. I'll definitely return again.
author: Roseann G.

description: Breakfast Burrito, chips, and coffee for $2.50. Not enormous, but quite big and filling enough and tasty. Plus all the salsa you can take. For $2.50. May be the best breakfast deal in town.
author: Darien W.

description:
So, at first bite, the carne asada taco was quite tasty. First thing I notice when I grip the taco: the corn tortillas are perfect. The temperature was not too hot to the point where I couldn't hold the taco without burning my hand, and the consistency was firm--you could tell they took the time to grill this to perfection on the burner. But most importantly, the double-layered morsels of goodness had a taste that was neither too strong nor too weak--just perfect, subtle hints of corn that hit the roof the mouth with the first bite.

The red sauce was quite tasty as well. Great consistency. Maybe it could have been a bit spicier, but all-in-all quite good.

Now, when taking the second bite, I really tried to hone in on the flavor of the meat. I was trying to isolate the flavor, and I got some, but it wasn't much. I then tried the meat by itself, and it just wasn't screaming as loud as I would have liked it to. It wasn't flavorless, and it wasn't flavorful--it simply had some flavor, and that's it. It was then when I realized why the first bite was so good, but the second bite was just merely okay: the meat was decent, but really the taco's flavor was coming from the double-layered corn tortillas and salsa roja that was holding it together.

For the reasons above, I rate these tacos as Asi, asi :| -- these tacos are okay, and I could come here again, but there are certainly betters.

Please note that this review in no way reflects the taqueria as a whole (atmosphere, location, etc); but rather, this review is reflective of the tacos served at the taqueria. For the full review and an explanation of my rating system, please visit my blog (url/link is in my profile).

-The Taco Guru
author: Taco G.

description: I have now been here three times and eaten a different burrito every time. The veggie burrito was the best. I don't know why other than the flavors blended best. The Carne Asada was a close second-the meat was very tender- this was actually the burrito I got the first time I went. I got the veggie burrito the second time I went because I'd already had meat three times that week which is my limit these days. This last time I was excited to try another type of burrito and was surprisingly disappointed. I had the bbq pork burrito. It was just strange tasting. I don't know how else to describe it. I actually didn't even finish it but I think my dog, Sheba, was pretty happy about that as she got to eat the pork I ripped out for her.  Next time I go back, I'm getting the veggie one with the works again. In fact, I think I'll go here when I'm eating too much meat because I know I'll be very  happy to order the veggie burrito.
author: Lucy W.

description: I love their Super Quesadillas. This is the best mexican food I've ever had. It has a really nice authentic mexican taste. Their meats are nice and juicy and the guacamole is the best in town.
author: Gladys P.

description: i used to stay away because of the lack of customers compared to lines outside cancun and farlito. i thought something must be wrong but i'd say their tacos are superior. half price tacos & burritos 3 to 6pm.
author: eric b.

description: tasty tacos. reasonably priced. friendly staff. fun art on the wall.
author: Meredith B.

description:
Two and 1/2  Stars. The Good: Extremely convenient location, Across from McDonald's, and steps from 24th Street and major bus stops and Bart.  Accepts ATM & credit cards. Varied and good menu with many out of the norm Mexican dishes.  Have Mexican specialties and seafood which can be awesome, if the right cook prepares it.  Has consistently good, medium priced food during weekend brunch - mornings. Has a breakfast Burrito and Coffee Special that beats McDonald's for the price. Has an afternoon Taco special, which is hard to beat. Free salsa & chips with order.
The Bad:  Don't use their bathroom, its gross. Go across the street to McDonald's. Thugs and homeless people can be bothersome, so don' t sit by the door. Closes early 10pm weekdays, it can be dangerous. The quality and size of the portions are extremely cook dependent (inconsistent). Sometimes the rice is not very good. You never know the quality of what you are going to get.
Experience. This last time, the two of us went there at 3PM.  Short line, clean with plenty of seating. I ordered chicken tacos and a burrito. The tacos were scrawny and were overloaded with onion and drowned in hot sauce. I like hot sauce and they were cheap, so that was OK to me but not to my friend. As for the Burrito, the rice was not very good and a Baby Burrito Around the corner is bigger.  I have eaten here many times and it is generally a good alternative to McDonald's, across the street (they both take ATM & credit cards), but it is way too cook dependent. I left hungry. (That cook has been moved or replaced since).
Conclusion, if you want out of the norm good reasonably priced Mexican dishes, go there in a weekend morning. If you want an inexpensive small breakfast burrito & coffee, during their morning special or their taco special in the afternoon they are good deals. If you are looking for good fast Taqueria food, go to either of the two other Taquerias in the 24th street corner. Their food might not be as good as Taqueria Taco Loco2 some times is, but the inconsistency in the size and taste of their food, particularly in the evenings, and the uncleanliness of their bathroom brings Taqueria Taco Loco2 down a star or two.
author: Charlie T.
